job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: ResponsibilitiesWork with a small team of data scientists, software engineers and domain experts to build the next generation of Noviâs platformDevelop novel solutions to open-ended, challenging and long-standing industry problemsEngage in thought leadership within the company and communityMentor other team members on domain knowledge and technical solutionsDevelop software to deliver solutions to ill-posed problems using sparse, noisy spatiotemporal dataRequired Skills & ExperienceMinimum 5 years of hands-on data science and machine learning experienceFoundation in integrating data-driven methods with physics-based modelsStrong foundation in statistics and machine LearningStrong software engineering principles and software development lifecycle experience (e.g., git, unit tests, CI)Strong familiarity with Python and PyData stack (e.g., pandas, numpy, scipy)Strong familiarity with ML Frameworks (e.g., scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow)Experience going from algorithm development to production codeExperience modeling time series and spatial datasetsExperience deploying callable ML models in a production environment (e.g., REST API, TensorFlow Serving)Preferred Skills & ExperienceOpen-source plotting libraries (e.g., altair, matplotlib, holoviz)Database query & ETL (SQL & NoSQL)AWS tools (e.g., lambda, EC2, etc.)Probabilistic programming (e.g., Stan, PyMC, Pyro)Model interpretation and explainability tools (e.g., Shapley)Linux systems and command-line interfaces (e.g., bash)Container and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, Nomad)Previous work on an agile teamExperience in oil and gas
